<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/biden-signs-executive-order-promote-fair-competition?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden Likes Fair Competition More Than Ice Cream
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/biden-signs-executive-order-promote-fair-competition?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Biden signing an executive agreement " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzIzL2JpZGVuX3NpZ25pbmdfYW5fZXhlY3V0aXZlX2FncmVlbWVudC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tired of Teddy Roosevelt getting all the “trustbuster” recognition in the history books, President Biden signed a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-technology-government-and-politics-health-care-reform-eafafad548c08d211ce8fc5954b00d6b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beefy executive order</a> yesterday containing 72 measures meant to target big business and promote competition in the US economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The order, which is less, “You must do this or else!” and more, “Here’s a guide to what I think,” reflects the Biden administration's focus on slowing corporate consolidation in order to help the US consumer. “In total, higher prices and lower wages caused by lack of competition are now estimated to cost the median American household $5,000 per year,” the White House said.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what’s the game plan? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The James Harden approach: Take an egregious amount of shots and hope you score some. The executive order mentions everything from shipping fees to over-the-counter hearing aids to banking mergers. Let’s look at some of the most interesting bits:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Noncompetes: </strong></span><span>The White House wants to </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-government-and-politics-01080611dc8a8f92c4eec6c6bb412f86?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">limit</a></span><span> employers’ ability to stop their employees from going to rivals, which Biden says would increase worker mobility and wages.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Transportation: </strong></span><span>Biden encouraged the Transportation Department to compel airlines to disclose fees and hand out refunds when your bags get lost or delayed.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tech mergers: </strong></span><span>The order </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-executive-order-antitrust-bigtech-e43a612c-159a-487d-99d0-e1d6c8b33bcc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calls for</a></span><span> “greater scrutiny of mergers, especially by dominant internet platforms...” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not everyone agrees that Corporate America is too concentrated. For example, the CEO of the Bank Policy Institute said in response to Biden’s order, “Banking is among the most competitive, least concentrated industries in America, as anyone who has shopped for a credit card, mortgage, or deposit account knows.” Republicans generally agree that consolidation isn’t a huge problem (at least outside of Big Tech).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Don’t expect Facebook to spin off Instagram because of this executive order. But it shows where Biden is focusing his attention, and it puts more pressure on Congress to revamp antitrust laws for the 21st century. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/richard-bransons-launch-preview?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Branson’s Finally Getting the Space He Wanted
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/richard-bransons-launch-preview?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Virgin Galactic's Carrier Aircraft, VMS Eve and VSS Unity Prepare for Flight" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzI4L3Zpcmdpbl9nYWxhY3RpY192bXNfZXZlX2FuZF92c3NfdW5pdHkuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Virgin Galactic (2018)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If all goes according to plan tomorrow, Richard Branson will win the first leg of the billionaire space race in time for brunch. Branson will be onboard Virgin Galactic’s VSS Unity flight, nine days ahead of Jeff Bezos’s expected launch for Blue Origin on July 20.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">VSS Unity isn’t like other spaceships.</strong> Instead of a traditional launch, the craft will take off in the air attached to a larger mothership called WhiteNightTwo at an altitude of 50,000 feet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the ship reaches peak altitude, Branson and the three other passengers—all Virgin Galactic employees—will feel weightless. The whole trip will last about an hour and a half.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Peak altitude = 57 miles above the ground, which won’t pass what scientists call the “Kármán line,” or the invisible boundary to outer space. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blue Origin </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/blueorigin/status/1413521627116032001?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bragged</a></span><span> on Twitter that it would be taking Bezos past the line at the end of the month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Branson is using this trip to show that space tourism is a legitimate industry, even if it will only be available to the ultra-rich for a while.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/cryptofriendly-wyoming-officially-recognizes-dao?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Old Faithful, Meet New Currency
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/cryptofriendly-wyoming-officially-recognizes-dao?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Brad Pitt as a cowboy tipping his hat" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=322 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fm5JqspHFgIXm/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Brad Pitt as a cowboy tipping his hat" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fm5JqspHFgIXm/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wyoming became the first US state to <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/wyoming-becomes-first-us-state-143455445.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially recognize</a> a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) this week, its latest step to becoming the country’s most crypto-friendly place to live.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To be specific, the Cowboy State announced that the American CryptoFed DAO is now an LLC.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">DAO 101: </strong>A DAO is any community that uses blockchain to govern itself without the intervention of a central authority. American CryptoFed’s mission, for instance, is to “create and sustain a monetary system with zero inflation, zero deflation, and zero transaction costs.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">If you already knew that…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wyoming wants you to round up your buddies and <a href="https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/bitcoin-wyoming-cryptocurrency-mining-us-b1879967.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">settle down</a> in Cody. The state has been writing new legislation to make its Zillow listings stand out to crypto folks, and it’s working: Major crypto companies Ripple and Kraken both set up operations there, as well as about 50 smaller LLCs with “bitcoin” in their names. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To make things official, Wyoming Senator Cynthia Lummis temporarily added laser eyes to her Twitter profile picture earlier this year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s in it for Wyoming? </strong>The US’ No. 1 coal-producing state is looking to crypto as a new means of revenue generation and jobs as it weans itself off Santa’s little punishment rock. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F09%2Fcryptofriendly-wyoming-officially-recognizes-dao" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We can all thank him for bringing the Brew into our lives, but this high-performer also 1) has a life outside of work and 2) is in pretty good shape tbh.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out, Alex Lieberman’s life outside of work includes a killer—and pup-tastic—fitness regimen that helps him tackle his work week as:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Executive Chairman</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Podcast host</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>LinkedIn enthusiast</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Etc. (etc., etc.)</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We gotchu a <em>behind the scenes</em> look at what fuels our fave boss-man to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/hoka/grind-and-unwind-with-alex-lieberman" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rise and grind on the weekdays and unwind on the weekends</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">TL;DR:</strong> He runs along the most iconic trail in New Jersey when most of us are reading our Brew in bed. Rambo, his pup, demands a healthy dose of hiking. And he only does it in shoes engineered for easy and seriously supportive experiences—like <a href="https://www.hokaoneone.com/morning-brew/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=rfr&utm_campaign=2021MorningBrew_Shop_MB&utm_content=PaidDirectPub" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">HOKA ONE ONE runners and hikers</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">See a different side of the media mogul in <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/hoka/grind-and-unwind-with-alex-lieberman" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Grind and Unwind with Alex Lieberman</a>. </p>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/key-performance-indicators-july-10?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Zaila Avant-garde competes in the first round of the the Scripps Nationa..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzI1L3VzLXBvbGl0aWNzLWJpZGVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jim Watson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Zaila Avant-garde not only became the first Black American to win the Scripps National Spelling Bee Thursday night, she also holds <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/09/us/zaila-avant-garde-spelling-bee-winner.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three Guinness world records</a> for basketball: most basketballs dribbled simultaneously (six for 30 seconds), most basketball bounces (307 in 30 seconds), and most bounce juggles in 1 minute (255 with four basketballs). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Hollywood as we know it is irrelevant. It no longer has any meaning or whatever. Streaming and everything, movies. It’s all really changed, and it no longer has hegemony over anything.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Media mogul Barry Diller <a href="https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/barry-diller-biden-order-sun-valley-1235015803/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acknowledged</a> at the Allen & Co. conference that the old-guard movie studios no longer have the power to shape culture that they once did.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Great Jones cookware and the illusion of the millennial aesthetic. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/infinite-scroll/great-jones-cookware-and-the-illusion-of-the-millennial-aesthetic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/money-matters-stay-patient-saving?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: How to Stay Patient When Saving?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/09/money-matters-stay-patient-saving?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Piggy bank GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ixZmwZC0R1Zi87EOqG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Piggy bank GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ixZmwZC0R1Zi87EOqG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Submit your money woes here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What are some tips for being patient when saving money? I’m currently doing a good job, but knowing how long it'll take to build up sizeable savings is bothering me.—Zach</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before I get to your question, a story: A few years ago, I had a (free) gym session with a trainer, and knowing my goals was of paramount importance. I told him I had none...which didn’t go over well.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, to be fair I had goals, but like you, I thought it’d take too long before I’d see results. I wanted abs, arms, maybe even a nice butt, but I wasn’t sure I’d ever get there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You see where I’m headed, Zach. Saving is like hitting the gym in that months and years may pass before you notice results, and consistency and persistence is the key. To stay motivated:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Maintain your focus by plastering pictures that represent your savings goals somewhere you can see them.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Periodically look back at how much you’ve saved (kind of like looking at “before” gym pics), because you might surprise yourself to see how far you’ve come from where you started.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Consider the alternatives to saving. If you stopped now and bought a cheaper version of whatever you’re saving for, would you be just as satisfied? The answer is probably no.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>P.S.: </em></strong><em>Later this summer, Ryan will be writing a twice-weekly personal finance newsletter to make you smarter about your money. </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Become one of the first subscribers</em></a><em>. </em></p>

Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTired of Teddy Roosevelt getting all the “trustbuster” recognition in the history books, President Biden signed a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-technology-government-and-politics-health-care-reform-eafafad548c08d211ce8fc5954b00d6b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeefy executive order\u003c/a\u003e yesterday containing 72 measures meant to target big business and promote competition in the US economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe order, which is less, “You must do this or else!” and more, “Here’s a guide to what I think,” reflects the Biden administration's focus on slowing corporate consolidation in order to help the US consumer. “In total, higher prices and lower wages caused by lack of competition are now estimated to cost the median American household $5,000 per year,” the White House said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what’s the game plan? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe James Harden approach: Take an egregious amount of shots and hope you score some. The executive order mentions everything from shipping fees to over-the-counter hearing aids to banking mergers. Let’s look at some of the most interesting bits:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNoncompetes: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe White House wants to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-government-and-politics-01080611dc8a8f92c4eec6c6bb412f86?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elimit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e employers’ ability to stop their employees from going to rivals, which Biden says would increase worker mobility and wages.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTransportation: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBiden encouraged the Transportation Department to compel airlines to disclose fees and hand out refunds when your bags get lost or delayed.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTech mergers: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe order \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biden-executive-order-antitrust-bigtech-e43a612c-159a-487d-99d0-e1d6c8b33bcc.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalls for\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “greater scrutiny of mergers, especially by dominant internet platforms...” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot everyone agrees that Corporate America is too concentrated. For example, the CEO of the Bank Policy Institute said in response to Biden’s order, “Banking is among the most competitive, least concentrated industries in America, as anyone who has shopped for a credit card, mortgage, or deposit account knows.” Republicans generally agree that consolidation isn’t a huge problem (at least outside of Big Tech).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDon’t expect Facebook to spin off Instagram because of this executive order. But it shows where Biden is focusing his attention, and it puts more pressure on Congress to revamp antitrust laws for the 21st century. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eVirgin Galactic (2018)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf all goes according to plan tomorrow, Richard Branson will win the first leg of the billionaire space race in time for brunch. Branson will be onboard Virgin Galactic’s VSS Unity flight, nine days ahead of Jeff Bezos’s expected launch for Blue Origin on July 20.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVSS Unity isn’t like other spaceships.\u003c/strong\u003e Instead of a traditional launch, the craft will take off in the air attached to a larger mothership called WhiteNightTwo at an altitude of 50,000 feet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the ship reaches peak altitude, Branson and the three other passengers—all Virgin Galactic employees—will feel weightless. The whole trip will last about an hour and a half.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePeak altitude = 57 miles above the ground, which won’t pass what scientists call the “Kármán line,” or the invisible boundary to outer space. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlue Origin \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/blueorigin/status/1413521627116032001?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebragged\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Twitter that it would be taking Bezos past the line at the end of the month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Branson is using this trip to show that space tourism is a legitimate industry, even if it will only be available to the ultra-rich for a while.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- crypto-friendly place to live.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo be specific, the Cowboy State announced that the American CryptoFed DAO is now an LLC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDAO 101: \u003c/strong\u003eA DAO is any community that uses blockchain to govern itself without the intervention of a central authority. American CryptoFed’s mission, for instance, is to “create and sustain a monetary system with zero inflation, zero deflation, and zero transaction costs.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIf you already knew that…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWyoming wants you to round up your buddies and \u003ca href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/bitcoin-wyoming-cryptocurrency-mining-us-b1879967.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esettle down\u003c/a\u003e in Cody. The state has been writing new legislation to make its Zillow listings stand out to crypto folks, and it’s working: Major crypto companies Ripple and Kraken both set up operations there, as well as about 50 smaller LLCs with “bitcoin” in their names. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo make things official, Wyoming Senator Cynthia Lummis temporarily added laser eyes to her Twitter profile picture earlier this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s in it for Wyoming? \u003c/strong\u003eThe US’ No. 1 coal-producing state is looking to crypto as a new means of revenue generation and jobs as it weans itself off Santa’s little punishment style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your I’m currently doing a good job, but knowing how long it'll take to build up sizeable savings is bothering me.—Zach\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore I get to your question, a story: A few years ago, I had a (free) gym session with a trainer, and knowing my goals was of paramount importance. I told him I had none...which didn’t go over well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, to be fair I had goals, but like you, I thought it’d take too long before I’d see results. I wanted abs, arms, maybe even a nice butt, but I wasn’t sure I’d ever get there.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou see where I’m headed, Zach. Saving is like hitting the gym in that months and years may pass before you notice results, and consistency and persistence is the key. To stay motivated:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMaintain your focus by plastering pictures that represent your savings goals somewhere you can see them.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePeriodically look back at how much you’ve saved (kind of like looking at “before” gym pics), because you might surprise yourself to see how far you’ve come from where you started.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eConsider the alternatives to saving. If you stopped now and bought a cheaper version of whatever you’re saving for, would you be just as satisfied? The answer is probably no.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eP.S.:
